daily-usage-possibly-difficult-facette-d: Daily usage may result in major difficulties
supports-daily-usage-but-built-for-livem: Can be used for daily work, but is built for live-mode
privacy-not-beneficial-facette-privacy-u: Distribution concept is not beneficial for anonymization purposes
packages-available-facette-privacy-usage: Programs for anonymization purposes are available
supports-gaming-usage-facette-gaming-usa: Distribution is actively supported by game publishers
packages-may-too-old-gaming-facette-gami: Programs versions may not be up-to-date enough for gaming
live-mode-only-facette-gaming-usage-desc: Has Live Mode: Can be started using discs or usb sticks to test it out (before installing)
gaming-may-require-additional-configurat: May require additional configuration for gaming
computer-knowledge-higher-facette-advanc: Usage requires less computer knowledge than answered
requires-advanced-knowledge-facette-adva: Requires reading up in manuals for usage
computer-knowledge-higher-facette-profes: Usage requires less computer knowledge than answered
requires-advanced-knowledge-facette-prof: Requires reading up in manuals for usage
requires-manual-facette-already-used-des: Requires reading of manuals and tutorials
installation-assistant-present-facette-m: The installation uses a installation 'wizard' with default settings
installation-from-shell-facette-many-pre: Installation is done using the command line interface
installs-range-of-programs-facette-comma: Installs a range of programs by default
selection-by-user-facette-commandline-se: Scope of pre-installed programs is decided by user
installation-presets-gui-facette-many-ch: Many settings can be done via a graphical interface
configuration-from-shell-facette-many-ch: Majority of configuration is done using shell commands
has-high-range-hardware-support-facette-: Supports a wide range of hardware
has-zorin-lite-version-facette-no64bit-d: Has a 'Zorin Lite' version for older computers
tutorial-facette-manuals-description: There are tutorials for troubleshooting and problem-solving
user-exchange-facette-need-human-help-de: There are user communities for knowledge sharing
has-windows-like-variant-cinnamon-facett: A variant ships the 'cinnamon' desktop environment, which has a Windows-like appearance
has-windows-like-variant-facette-ux-conc: Has variants with a windows-like user interface
mac-like-facette-ux-concept-answer-mac-l: GUI concept has elements of macOS
paid-version-existing-facette-paid-suppo: There is a non-free version of this distribution
free-software-unfree-per-default-facette: Closed source programs are installed by default
free-userselection-facette-license-open-: Usage of free software depends on user selection
free-software-unfree-per-default-facette: Closed source programs are installed by default
privacy-thirdparty-facette-privacy-no-co: Connects to third party services by default
user-selection-affects-privacy-facette-p: User has to select the software to use
supports-privacy-facette-privacy-no-conn: Only collects data when online services are used
privacy-thirdparty-facette-okay-when-wor: Connects to third party services by default
appstore-facette-app-store-gui-descripti: Software installation can be done using an app store
console-facette-software-admin-answer-co: Software installation can be done using the terminal
administration-shell-facette-software-ad: Administration is mostly done by using shell commands
systemd-is-avoidable-per-selection-facet: Systemd can be avoided per user selection
ships-systemd-but-disabled-facette-no-sy: Systemd is shipped, but disabled by default
updates-fast-facette-prefer-fast-descrip: Updates are fast, but can be unstable
stable-updates-facette-prefer-stable-des: Updates are mostly stable when published
debian-updates-slow-facette-prefer-fast-: Debian updates are usually slow in favor of stability
runs-in-isolation-facette-privacy-isolat: Software execution happens in isolated environments
knoppix-adriane-facette-impaired-view-us: The ADRIANE project offers tools and solutions for visually impaired people
has-software-for-blind-facette-impaired-: Software for visually impaired people are installable (e. g. 'Orca')
has-live-mode-facette-live-mode-usage-de: Has a live mode which allows starting from disc
slow-release-model-facette-prefer-stable: Available software versions may be older than latest version from vendor
general-remark-additional-eula-facette-p: The privacy policy of the distribution should be read carefully during installation
general-remark-additional-eula-facette-o: The privacy policy of the distribution should be read carefully during installation
configuration-from-shell-desc-facette-ma: Installation is done using a terminal based installer.
distro_age: Distribution should be established more than:
must_have_assignment: Prefer distributions with at least one assigment in the result list
no_results_text: Based on the given answers, none of the Distributions in our database matches your preferences. Please review your answers!
about_page_opendata_text: Distrochooser offers an Open Data access point for own statistical purposes. Please note the license displayed in the HTTP response.
translation-mode-description: Click on texts to translate them. Navigation dropdown using the central navigation is disabled; but you can still navigate back and forth using the arrow buttons. Translateable texts show a crosshair-style cursor on hover.
voter_id_text: This service generates a random text when voting for other users suggestions. This is done to prevent vote spamming. This ID is only transferred when doing votes and is not used for anything else.
no_voter_id: You don't have an ID yet.
language-vote-privacy: While translations can be provided anonymously, votes on other user translation suggestions use a random ID to prevent abuse. You can find more about this on our privacy page.
test_in_own_language: This test is also available in your language
result_will_be_empty: You did not make any selections. The result will be empty.
must_match_language-not-suitable-descrip: Is not available in the given language
must_match_language: Distribution must match language of the questionnaire
description_text_long: In the following questionnaire, you will be asked several question about different topics to help us identify your personal requirements. You can skip question if desired or change your answers at any time. At the end of the questionnaire, you will get your personal recommendation result.
version-page-text: You can select a simplified questionaire edition, which removes some super technical questions
linux-knowledge-page-text: How would you rate your knowledge with the Linux operating system?
scenario-page-text: Some distributions are made for a special purpose, some for daily use. What do you need?
pc-knowledge-page-text: How would you rate your proficiency using a computer?
installation-page-text: How many settings do you wish to tweak by yourself during installation? How many configuration variables should be filled with default values?
ux-page-text: Linux can use a lot of different User Interfaces ("Desktops"). Many distributions ship one desktop as default. It is important to know if you have any preferences for a desktop concept. You can switch and install new desktops at any time!
pricing-page-text: Most distributions are free. Some distributions offer additional support for a one-time fee.
scope-page-text: Different distributions pre-install different amounts of software. Some install a complete suite of basic programs to work "out of the box". Other distributions offer only a base install to then let the user install what programs they want to use.
ideology-page-text: The (license) ideology of a distribution is a contentious debate. There are distributions using mostly "free-licenses", others also use "non-free" software.
ideology-page-help: Free licenses allow the user to modify, redistribute and use the software for any purpose. There are situations where a distribution has to use non-free software, for example for hardware drivers. Non-free software does not distribute its sourcecode and modifications are not allowed.
privacy-page-text: Some distributions use online services to improve the user experience. This may affect the privacy of the user, i.e. the user can be tracked when using such online features.
administration-page-text: There are many ways to administrate a Linux distribution, e. g. to install software.
updates-page-text: Some distributions offer faster updates, which can affect system stability. What do you prefer?
version-page-help: The questionnaire on distrochooser.de is available in multiple versions. The simplified version is designed for users with less technical knowledge.
scenario-page-help: Help us by setting a scope on your desired Linux usage.
pc-knowledge-page-help: Some Linux distributions are more complicated to install and use than others. How do you rate your personal expertise with computers?
linux-knowledge-page-help: Some Linux distributions are more complicated to install and use than others. How do you rate your personal expertise with Linux in general?
installation-page-help: There are multiple approaches on how to install Linux distributions. Some might require more expertise in Linux while others result in a more simple way more suitable for new users.
updates-page-help: Distributions follow different approaches when packaging updates. Some distributions focus on fast updates, which can influence the stability of the system. Other distributions focus on stable updates, which result in longer wait time for new versions.
personal-requirements-page-help: On this step, you can define some additional filters for the result suggestions.
welcome_widget_skip_questions: You can always skip questions, if you want!
welcome_widget_get_answer_any_time: You can always click on 'your recommendation' to receive your result
welcome_widget_any_order: You may answer in arbitrary order
welcome_widget_delete_any_time: You can delete answers at any time
about_page_text:
distrochooser.de attempts to help Linux beginners to choose a Linux distribution suited to their needs.
The given results are suggestions based on your answers. Sometimes results may be not as fitting, because of complex interactions between answers.
welcome_mark_unsure: You can highlight questions where you are unsure about your answer
welcome_widget_mark_weight: You can weight answers influence your result
cookies_alert: We use cookies for techical reasons. There won't be any personalized tracking. You can find more information on the following page:
support_text: You want to support the project? Thank you! Sharing the project link or joining the discussion helps a lot! You can find our community links below. We are always open for contributions in case you want to support us in this way!
debug_mode_on_description: The debug mode is ON. Expect additional output.
negative: Not suitable based on your answers
about_page_license_text: Distrochooser.de is Open Source software. You can find more information about the license on
about_page_license_database_text: Starting with version 6, the decision matrix is part of the repository. You can find the definition in the /doc/ folder. The live data might be published at a later point.
privacy_page_text: Distrochooser.de does not utilze any personalized logging. Due to technical reasons, the page sets a cookie as described below.
privacy_page_csrf_cookie_session_lifetim: To implement a security mechanism called CSRF, the page creates a random session key which is stored in a cookie. This cookie has a long livetime due to technical reasons.
You can find more information on this page
privacy_page_cookie_session_lifetime: Sesion data. Is used to remember which answers are selected
locale_incomplete: This translation is incomplete. You can help by providing missing translation values here!
privacy_page_stored_text: We do not save personalized data. We store following statistical information about the result:
privacy_page_stored_text_user_agent: Your browser user agent, which does not identify a specific user
privacy_page_stored_ref: A referrer, if any. Your browser settings might already empty this information
privacy_page_stored_text_why: We store this information to allow us to create statistics about the usage of the service. The data is generic and is not related to specific users and has the goal to identify issues with the service itself
imprint_disclaimer_text: We do not take any liability for the pages linked in this service. If you find a malicous link on this website, please inform us using our contact information.
welcome_widget_flag: You can give feedback on results to help us to improve the service
description_text: The Distrochooser helps you to find the suitable Linux distribution based on your needs!
ubuntu-description: Ubuntu is a Distribution built by the company Canonical
debian-description: Debian is a distribution with high focus on stability
tails-description: Anonymization is the main focus of Tails, which can be used from USB or optical discs
devuan-description: Devuan is a Debian clone without usage of the systemd toolkit
arch-description: Arch is a rolling release distribution based on the KISS principle
mint-description: Linux Mint is a Ubuntu based distribution with pre-installed proprietary components, such as multimedia codecs.
opensuse-description: openSUSE aims to deliver a stable and user-friendly distribution, mostly for end users
solus-description: Solus OS is a rolling release distribution which started as a Chrome OS clone
manjaro-description: Manjaro is a rolling release distribution focused on user friendliness
pclinuxos-description: PCLinuxOS is a Mandrake-based distribution focused on a user-friendly interface.
rocky-description: Rocky Linux is a open source distribution targeted to be 100% compatible with Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)
rhel-description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) is a enterprise and stability focused distribution
mxlinux-description: MX Linux is a middleweight resource usage distribution with focus on a efficient and elegant daily usage.
fedora-description: Fedora is a Red Hat backed distribution with a large focus on free software
gentoo-description: Gentoo is a flexible distribution for advanced users
knoppix-description: Knoppix is a live-mode focused operating system with a wide range of hardware support
cruxlinux-description: Crux Linux is a lightweight 64 bit focused operating system with recent tools and libraries
zorinos-description: Zorin OS is a beginner focused distribution with a windows-like user interface
elementaryos-description: elementary OS is a Ubuntu-based distribution, focused on an elegant and fast user experience
qubesos-description: Qubes OS executes processes in virtual machines in favor of security
nixos-description: NixOS uses the Nix package manager. It uses declarative configuration and allows reliable system upgrades.
xubuntu-description: Xubuntu is an Ubuntu-based distribution powered by the lightweight XFCE desktop environment
lubuntu-description: Lubuntu is an Ubuntu-based distribution powered by the lightweight LXQt desktop environment
ubuntumate-description: Ubuntu MATE is an Ubuntu-based distribution powered by the lightweight MATE desktop environment
void-description: Void Linux is a rolling release distribution without systemd
artix-description: Artix is an Arch Linux based distribution which can use several init systems besides systemd, for example OpenRC
kubuntu-description: Kubuntu is an Ubuntu-based distribution with a pre-installed KDE as a desktop
popos-description: Pop!_OS is an Ubuntu-based distribution powered by the GNOME desktop environment customized from System76
deepin-description: Deepin is a chinese, Debian based Distribution offering an own desktop called Deepin Desktop Environment.
app-store-gui-description: I want to install my programs using a kind of "App store"
manuals-description: I am able to solve my problems using guides from wiki pages or tutorials
need-human-help-description: I prefer asking others for help
license-open-source-description: I want to use free licenses as much as I can
proprietary-okay-when-working-descriptio: I'm fine with non-free licenses as long as my system works
many-preselections-description: I want to use the default preset values in the installation assistant
commandline-setup-description: I want to choose the settings by myself
many-choices-gui-description: I want to configure as much as possible using graphical applications
no-linux-contact-description: I have little or no knowledge about Linux-based operating systems
already-used-description: I have already used Linux-based operating systems for some purposes
knowledge-present-description: I have a good understanding about Linux-based operating systems
no64bit-description: I'm not sure about this and/or my computer already has performance issues and/or only supports 32 bit
beginner-usage-description: I often need help from others to fix problems with my computer
advanced-usage-description: I am already able to solve some computer problems by myself
professional-usage-description: I can troubleshoot most or all computer problems by myself
paid-support-ok-description: I would be fine to pay a fee
okay-when-working-description: If it improves my user experience, I agree with using such online services
daily-usage-description: I want a distribution for daily use
privacy-usage-description: I want to use Linux for anonymous web browsing.
gaming-usage-description: I prefer a distribution which is supported by game publishers.
privacy-isolation-usage-description: I want to execute all programs in an isolated area
live-mode-usage-description: Has Live Mode: Can be started using discs or usb sticks to test it out (before installing)
scope-out-of-the-box-description: I prefer a distribution shipping all the basic programs I need to start working immediately after installation
scope-own-selection-description: I want to choose the basic programs to install myself
ux-concept-answer-windows-like-descripti: I prefer a windows-like user interface
ux-concept-answer-mac-like-description: I prefer a macOS-like user interface
software-admin-answer-console-descriptio: I want to install software mostly using terminal commands
installation-facettes-shell-facette-many: The amount of installed software is based on a selection made from the terminal based installation
configuration-facettes-shell-facette-man: The installation is based on an installation wizard with a graphical user interface
